p: A combination of the drugs used against HIV, a malaria vaccine first tested during the Second World War, and a new antiviral against Ebola last year whose promise waned. On March 20, 2020, the WHO initiated a large global project, called SOLIDARITY, to find out if any of these drugs can be used with the new coronavirus infections to cure the deadly respiratory illness. The project also examines unapproved medications that have performed well with the other two deadly coronaviruses in animal studies, causing severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) (Kupferschmidt and Cohen 2020).
